description: From French postulant, present participle of postuler.

entries.meaning: (religion) A person seeking admission to a religious order.
examples: After their six-month postulancies are over and they have mastered all the chants and books of monastic regulations, the postulants are finally ready to ordain as novice monks  [â€¦]

entries.meaning: A person who submits a petition for something; a petitioner.
examples: But when the three postulants returned with Sabine it was clear that the results had been far from satisfactory, perhaps because of the massive potations of the old lady.
